qas.question: What is the JK Bridge a nickname for?
What does the JK Bridge cross?
Who was the JK Bridge named for?

answers.text: architect Alexandre Chan and structural engineer Mário Vila Verde

qas.question: What did Juscelino Kubitschek de Oliveira design?
What was Alexandre Chan former president of?
What did Mario Vila Verde win in 2003?
What does the Mario Vila Verde bridge cross?
Where was the Gustav Lindenthal Conference located?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>The Juscelino Kubitschek bridge<b5_0/><a0_0/>, also known as the 'President JK Bridge' or the 'JK Bridge', crosses <a1_0><b8_0>Lake Paranoá<a1_0/> in Brasília<b8_0/>. It is named after <a2_0>Juscelino Kubitschek de Oliveira<a2_0/>, <a3_0>former president of <b6_0>Brazil<b6_0/><a3_0/>. It was designed by <a4_0>architect Alexandre Chan and structural engineer Mário Vila Verde<a4_0/>. Chan won <b7_0>the Gustav Lindenthal Medal<b7_0/> for this project at the 2003 International Bridge Conference in <b9_0>Pittsburgh<b9_0/> due to "...outstanding achievement demonstrating harmony with the environment, aesthetic merit and successful community participation".
